doc.field: Mrs. Edward H. Webster collection of large format photographic portraits
Mrs. Edward H. Webster collection of large format photographic portraits

The Mrs. Edward H. Webster collection of large format photographic portraits, dating from the late 19th century, contains three black-and-white oversize portraits showing Caroline Blackwell (Blossom) Tisdale, William S. Tisdale, and Josephine Mason (Hill) Parker.

The Mrs. Edward H. Webster collection of large format photographic portraits, dating from the late 19th century, contains three black-and-white oversize portraits showing Caroline Blackwell (Blossom) Tisdale, William S. Tisdale, and Josephine Mason (Hill) Parker.

The Mrs. Edward H. Webster collection of large format photographic portraits, dating from the late 19th century, contains three black-and-white oversize portraits showing Caroline Blackwell (Blossom) Tisdale, William S. Tisdale, and Josephine Mason (Hill) Parker.

Josephine Mason Parker (nee Hill) was the daughter of John J. and Mary M. Hill. She married Frederick Sheldon Parker, a lawyer, on May 16, 1876 in Brooklyn. She died on February 19, 1879. Frederick Sheldon Parker lived at 32 Garden Place in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn.

William S. Tisdale (1816-1888) was born in Taunton, MA. In 1843, Tisdale married Caroline Blackwell Blossom (1824-1884) in Brooklyn. She was the daughter of Benjamin and Margaret (nee Blackwell) Blossom. William and Caroline Tisdale had four children and lived on Hicks Street in Brooklyn Heights.
The Blossom and Hill families lived on Hicks Street in Brooklyn Heights. In 1872, Sarah C. Hill (1851-1903) married Frederick Blossom (b. 1830) in Brooklyn.
Gift of Mrs. Edward H. Webster, 1958.
